insurance_coverage_type: coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed luggage

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the travel insurance call transcript below and extract key customer requirements.
Step 1: Read the transcript carefully and extract all relevant details. For each field in the schema, provide a brief annotation or reference to the specific portion(s) of the transcript where the detail was found.
Step 2: Review your annotations to verify that every extracted detail directly matches the transcript. Resolve any discrepancies or conflicts in the data.
Step 3: Produce a final, validated JSON object that adheres exactly to the TravelInsuranceRequirement schema

If a field is not mentioned in the transcript, use null.

Transcript:
Customer Service Agent: Good morning, thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd Singapore. My name is Sarah. How may I help you today?
Customer: Oh, hello Sarah. Yes, I need to ask about... insurance? For travelling? I'm really quite lost about all this, sorry.
Customer Service Agent: Not a problem at all, I can certainly help guide you through gathering what you need. To start, could you tell me where you'll be travelling to?
Customer: Yes, we're planning a trip to Australia.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, Australia. And how long will you be away for?
Customer: We'll be away for 10 days. Leaving from Singapore, of course. We're based in Singapore.
Customer Service Agent: Understood, 10 days to Australia, departing from Singapore. And how many people will be travelling?
Customer: There will be 2 of us travelling.
Customer Service Agent: Alright, two travellers. And roughly, which age group do the travellers fall into? Is it 18-25, 26-40, 41-55, 56-65, or 65+?
Customer: Uhm, we're mostly around 41-55 years old.
Customer Service Agent: Got it, 41-55 age group. Do you have a budget in mind for the insurance policy?
Customer: We're hoping to spend maybe around $200-$300? Is that realistic? I don't really know.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, noted the budget range of $200-$300. Now, are there any specific activities you plan to do during your trip? Like any sports or adventure activities?
Customer: Activities... well, the main reason we are going is for golf. Lots of golf. Are there... things for golf? I'm a bit worried about my clubs. What if they get lost or broken on the flight? Is that covered?
Customer Service Agent: Okay, so cover for golf equipment is something you need information on. Lost or damaged. Noted.
Customer: Yes. And, what if, say, I twist my ankle the day before we're supposed to play? We pay for the golf course fees in advance, you see. Can we get that money back if we can't play? The unused green fees?
Customer Service Agent: Alright, so you're also asking about reimbursement for unused green fees due to unforeseen circumstances. I've made a note of that.
Customer: Yes, exactly. And... oh dear, this sounds silly, but those golf buggies you drive on the course? What happens if I accidentally bump it into something and damage it? It's quite worrying.
Customer Service Agent: Understood. So, you need information on coverage related to accidental damage caused to a rented golf buggy.
Customer: Yes, please. And one more thing about golf... my friend mentioned some insurance gives a special benefit if you get a hole-in-one? Is that true? It would be amazing, though unlikely for me! But just asking.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, so you're also interested in knowing about any available 'hole-in-one' benefits. Noted. Are there any other activities besides golf?
Customer: No, no other special activities planned. Just the golf and sightseeing.
Customer Service Agent: Okay. Thinking about the trip more generally, what are some other situations you might be concerned about or want protection for?
Customer: Oh, um... well, what happens if one of us gets sick while we're in Australia? Like, needing to see a doctor or ending up in hospital? That sounds expensive.
Customer Service Agent: Alright, so understanding the coverage for medical expenses incurred overseas, like doctor visits or hospital stays, is important for you.
Customer: Yes, definitely. And... sorry to ask so many basic questions... but what if something happens *before* we go? Like, if one of us gets very ill suddenly and we have to cancel the whole holiday? Do we lose all the money we paid?
Customer Service Agent: Noted. You need information on coverage regarding trip cancellation due to unforeseen events like illness before departure.
Customer: Right. And what about our normal bags, our suitcases? What if the airline loses them, or they arrive days late? It would be terrible to arrive with nothing.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, so you're also looking for details on coverage for luggage that is lost, damaged, or delayed by the airline.
Customer: Yes. And... uh... flight delays? Sometimes you hear about people getting stuck for a whole day. Does insurance help with... like, needing a hotel room or food if the plane is very, very delayed?
Customer Service Agent: Understood. Information regarding coverage for significant travel delays, including expenses like accommodation and meals, is also required.
Customer Service Agent: Just a couple more things to ensure we capture everything. Does anyone travelling have any pre-existing medical conditions, like asthma or high blood pressure, that we should be aware of?
Customer: Oh, no. No, no pre-existing conditions for either of us.
Customer Service Agent: Okay, thank you. And will you be travelling with any special medical equipment, like a wheelchair or CPAP machine?
Customer: No, nothing like that needed.
Customer Service Agent: Perfect. So, just to quickly summarize what you're looking for information on for your 10-day trip to Australia for two travellers aged 41-55 departing from Singapore, with a budget around $200-$300: You need details on medical coverage overseas, trip cancellation protection, coverage for lost, damaged, or delayed luggage, and help with expenses during significant travel delays. Specifically related to golf, you need information on coverage for golf equipment, reimbursement for unused green fees, liability for golf buggy damage, and potential hole-in-one benefits. Does that sound correct?
Customer: Yes, I think... I think that's everything. It sounds like a lot when you say it like that! Sorry if I was confusing.
Customer Service Agent: Not at all, you were very clear. Thank you for providing all those details. That gives us a good understanding of the information you require. I have recorded these requirements.
Customer: Okay, good. Thank you for your patience, Sarah.
Customer Service Agent: You're most welcome. Thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. Have a great day!
Customer: You too. Bye bye.
tasks_output.expected_output: A JSON object that matches the TravelInsuranceRequirement model.
